questions.question:
The tendency of being reduced of six ionic species increases in the order as shown below:
Ba<sup>2+</sup>(aq) < Na<sup>+</sup>(aq) < Mg<sup>2+</sup>(aq) < H<sup>+</sup>(aq) < Cu<sup>2+</sup>(aq) < Hg<sup>2+</sup>(aq)

options.content: Ba(s) does NOT react with H<sup>+</sup>(aq)
Na(s) has a stronger reducing power than Hg(l)
Hg<sup>2+</sup>(aq) is the weakest oxidising agent among the six species
Displacement reaction occurs when Cu(s) is immersed in MgSO<sub>4</sub>(aq)

Pass these gases through concentrated sulphuric acid
Cool these gases to liquefy SO<sub>2</sub> for subsequent removal

questions.question:
Consider the following information concerning metals W, X, Y and Z:
(1) Heating oxide of W gives metal W
(2) Heating metal X in steam gives a colourless gas

Which of these metals has the lowest reactivity?
